Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant met the residence requirements under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Appellant spent significant time in Saudi Arabia for studies and family life, maintained minimal ties to Canada, and had intent to return but no established residence in Canada
Defendant_Behavior: Prolonged absence from Canada, primary residence in Saudi Arabia
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over interpretation and fulfillment of physical residence requirement
Legal_Standard: Three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application; distinction between 'residence' and 'domicile'; temporary absence allowed
Assessment_Factor: Duration and purpose of absences, strength of ties to Canada, intent to reside
Procedural_Issue: Appeal from Citizenship Judge's decision, trial de novo
Review_Standard: De novo review of facts and law
Evidence_Used: Evidence of time spent in Saudi Arabia, nature of family and study commitments, limited connections to Canada
Application_Basis: Physical presence and residential connection to Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Appellant's travel history, residential ties, intent
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and approval of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Applicant must have three years of residence in Canada within four years before application; absence must be temporary
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence demonstrating actual residence in Canada
Cause_Description: Appellant's citizenship application was denied due to non-compliance with residence requirements
Evidence_Handling: Reviewed documentary and testimonial evidence regarding residence and absences
Evidence_Assessment: Findings that appellant did not establish residence in Canada despite intent
Decision_Rationale: Significant time abroad, minimal ties to Canada, absence not temporary; no actual residence established
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of residence based on physical presence and settled intention
